text:
MOHD JUNAID KHAN  
Contact : 7860503784  / 9568953098  
E-Mail: junaidcps @yahoo .com  
 
 
 
 
Profile Summary  
 
 
 Successfully completed master degree in Petroleum Exploration from University of petroleum and 
Energy Studies Dehradun, Uttarakhand, India.  
 Completing 6 - month master’s thesis in KDMIPE , ONGC India . Tittle of thesis is “identification of 
Bypassed oil in water drive matured reservoir” and prepared a research paper  to be published.    
 Teaching Assistant (TA) under Associate Prof. Dr. Pankaj Srivastava at University of Petroleum and 
Energy Studies, Dehradun.  
 Teach  as reasoning  teacher  at KIM India coaching Institute Dehradun.  
 One research paper has been published IJESM, another is prepared to be submitted.  
 Second research paper is prepared and submitted to publish.  
 Extensive work experience of more than 1 - years  in Oil and Gas industries including installation 
and monitoring o f pumping units and hydraulic recovery  systems  site visit and repair and 
maintenances of accessories of plants.  
 More than 8 -year experience in paint industries had worked for Asian Paints as exclusive service 
engineer including the Installation and mainten ance of color dispensing machines, Training and 
customer supports.  
 Operated as a Mechanical Engineer for Saudi Aramco , Al-Hasa Dammam in 2011; coordinating the 
service and repair work at plant site.  
 Making site visit and participating in service and repair  meetings and coordinate the team to 
accomplish the work.  
 Certified  by IIT’s in Geo -technical Laboratories, Geo Environmental E ngineering and Modeling and 
Simulation of dynamic systems.  
 Also certified in some petroleum software such as CMG and PETREL . Soft skills MATLAB, SUFER, Ms. 
Word, Excel and power point.  
 Team work, under pressure working capability  and enterprising leader.  
 Sensitive to the dynamics of cross -cultural workspaces; open  to worldwide  relocation .

Work Experience  
 
 
(Dec. 2017 to June 2018) Project Trainee, KDMIPE ONGC Dehradun  
 
 Project tittle; “Identification of Bypassed Oil in water drive Matured Reservoir”  
Worked as a Project fellow for six month, Responsibility to identify the oil bypassed area of an old matured field of 
India.  
 
Highlights:  
 Going through research paper and matured field reports to comprehend the field performance and recently  
drilled well s’ performance.  
 Collecting data and parameters of r eservoir from field reports.  
 Using excel, Petrel, and surfer to prepare the map and mathematical calculations.  
 PVT analysis of crude oil samples from IRS Ahmadabad.  
 Reporting and filing the PVT reports.  
 
Previous Assignments  
 
 
(Aug’ 2011 – Aug’ 2016) Senior service Engineer; Corob (i) Pvt . Ltd. 
Worked as senior service engineer for 5 year, Corob is a company which provides complete color solution to paints 
industries. Its big business partners are ASIAN PAINTS, AKZO NOBLE, JOTUN PAINTS, NIPPON PAINTS & 
BRITISH PAINTS and many others big br ands.  
   
Highlights:  
 Successfully supervised 3 maintenance team members assisting with the system installation , repair & testing, 
and 100 contractor mechanical and electrical  employees . 
 Trained 5 training engineers and many Dealers shop boy.  
 Supervised te chnical and non -technical staff as  required for successfully of company’s business.  
 Plan and search better way to achieve the service goal on time.  
 Handling inventory control and stock records.  
 Meetings with sales executives and area manger weekly.  
 
Feb’11  – July’ 11  with MSG Estates  collaboration wi th Saudi ARAMCO Oil and Gas, as Mechanical  Engineer  
 
 Participating in service related Aramco meetings, site visit, e stimating, costing and submits  the bid.  Maintained daily 
reports in . Interfaced and monitored all the site activities along with subcontractor supervisors and FW supervisors for 
the smooth running of the project.  Coordinating and monitoring the plant’s service work.  
 
 
 
Highlights:  
 
 Worked as Mechanical engineer in Saudi Aramco Oil and Gas . 
 Responsible for execute and monitoring the plant ’s service work and maintenance.  
 Proactively managed, supported and facilitated internal and external workflow to project completion and customer  satisfaction  
 Successfully executed multiple projects from co ncept to  installation

Worked as a service engineer, CPS COLOR provides engineering, color and pigment solution to leading paints 
industries.  
 
 
Highlights:

  Software installation and price updating of Asian Paints.  
 Supervised technical and non -technical staff as required for successfully of company’s business.  
 Plan and search b etter way to achieve the service goal on time.
